doc.previous: The University Museum of Natural History holds the University s zoological entomological and geological specimens It is housed in a large neo Gothic building on Parks Road in the University s Science Area 83 84 Among its collection are the skeletons of a Tyrannosaurus rex and Triceratops and the most complete remains of a dodo found anywhere in the world It also hosts the Simonyi Professorship of the Public Understanding of Science currently held by Marcus du Sautoy
doc.after: Adjoining the Museum of Natural History is the Pitt Rivers Museum founded in 1884 which displays the University s archaeological and anthropological collections currently holding over 500 000 items It recently built a new research annexe its staff have been involved with the teaching of anthropology at Oxford since its foundation when as part of his donation General Augustus Pitt Rivers stipulated that the University establish a lectureship in anthropology
